course_title: Culture and Social Psychology Empirical Research (CASPER) Workshop
course_description: This workshop focuses on teaching graduate students how to produce research, ranging from the initial design of a study to eventual submission for publication. The following types of graduate students will be eligible for participation in the workshop: (a) those who specialize in culture and/or social psychology; and (b) those who are currently involved in some stage of the research process (e.g., beginning a project, revising a paper, conducting data analysis, working on a dissertation proposal). Throughout the semester, we will address the particular efforts of each student.  Each workshop member will provide constructive comments at our meetings.
sections: Class Nbr: 3065, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 1-3:45p, Instructor: Dowd/Johnson, Status: Open
